Page Name: Market Order - Instrument Selection
URL: 
Description: This page allows users to select an instrument for a market order. It presents a form with an instrument finder and displays non-editable fields related to the selected instrument.

Flow Name: unitair_market_order
Step ID: 1
Step Name: Instrument Selection
input (type=text, label=Instrument, required=True) with selector: input#mat-input-20
button (type=button, label=No label, required=False) with selector: button[mat-icon-button]
input (type=text, label=Libellé abrégé, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-21
input (type=text, label=Libellé, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-22
button (type=None, label=Suivant, required=False) with selector: button:contains('Suivant')
✅ User types a valid instrument name into the 'Instrument' input field, selects the correct instrument from the autocomplete suggestions. The 'Suivant' button becomes enabled.
❌ User leaves the 'Instrument' field empty or types an invalid instrument name. The 'Suivant' button remains disabled, preventing the user from proceeding.

Page Name: Market Order - Form Filling
URL: 
Description: This page allows users to create and manage market orders. It includes sections for selecting instruments, defining order details through a dynamic form, and specifying portfolio ventilation. The form is likely used to input and confirm the details of a trade order before it's executed.

Flow Name: unitair_market_order
Step ID: 2
Step Name: Order Form Details
button (type=button, label=Editer, required=False) with selector: button[title="Editer"]
input (type=text, label=Instrument, required=True) with selector: input#mat-input-20
input (type=text, label=Libellé abrégé, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-21
input (type=text, label=Libellé, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-22
input (type=text, label=Valeur, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-32
input (type=text, label=Courtier, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-33
input (type=text, label=Dépositaire, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-34
input (type=text, label=Date de l'ordre, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-35
input (type=text, label=Date valeur, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-36
input (type=text, label=Contrepartie, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-37
input (type=string, label=Prix, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-38
input (type=text, label=Date d'expiration, required=False) with selector: input#mat-input-39
button (type=button, label=Ajouter une ligne, required=False) with selector: button:contains('Ajouter une ligne')
button (type=button, label=Annuler, required=False) with selector: button:contains('Annuler')
button (type=button, label= Valider , required=False) with selector: button:contains(' Valider ')
button (type=button, label=Confirmer, required=False) with selector: button:contains('Confirmer')

✅ A user successfully creates a market order by selecting an instrument, filling in all the required fields in the dynamic form (like order date, value date, counterparty, and price), and allocating the order to different portfolios with specified quantities. The user then validates and confirms the order.

❌ A user attempts to create a market order without selecting an instrument or enters invalid data into required fields, such as an incorrect date format or a negative price. The system should display appropriate validation errors, preventing the user from proceeding until the errors are corrected.
